metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7144 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
OpenStack keystonemiddleware (formerly python-keystoneclient) 0.x before0.11.0 and 1.x before 1.2.0 disables certification verification when the"insecure" option is set in a paste configuration (paste.ini) fileregardless of the value, which allows remote attackers to conductman-in-the-middle attacks via a crafted certificate.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7144` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-keystoneclient - 1:0.7.1-ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-keystoneclient package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:0.7.1-ubuntu1.2').
